```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "We evaluate an intervention targeting early life nutrition and well-being for households in extreme poverty in Northern Nigeria.",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Child Development Grant Program (CDGP)",
    "country": "Nigeria",
    "region": "Northern Nigeria",
    "target_population": "Households in extreme poverty, specifically pregnant women and their children"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "unconditional cash transfer",
      "cash_amount": "US$22 per month",
      "cash_frequency": "monthly",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "The value of the unconditional cash transfer is US$22 per month. This is substantial, corresponding to 85% of women's monthly earnings or 26% of monthly food expenditures. Women can start to receive transfers while the child is in utero until the child turns 24-months old."
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["livestock"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "Women's ownership of any animal increases by 5.9pp (10%) after two years, rising significantly to 11.5pp (19%) by the four-year endline. Livestock ownership is critical in this economic environment because: (i) it generates earnings for women from the sale of animal produce such as milk and eggs; (ii) it produces a stable earnings stream all year round."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "child health",
      "child nutrition",
      "stunting reduction",
      "dietary diversity",
      "women's labor supply",
      "income/earnings",
      "business investments",
      "poverty reduction",
      "savings/financial"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "We document that this program led to substantial improvements in the health and nutrition of targeted children, as well as remarkable impacts on the economic lives of mothers, namely their labor supply, income, and business investments. | We find that at the two-year midline, treated children have a large increase in their HAZ score by 0.20 relative to those in the control group; (ii) at the lower tail of the distribution, there is a reduction in stunting of 8%. | Monthly food consumption rises by $21 (25%) after two years, and this increase is mostly sustained at endline. By endline, the stock of household savings increases, and the stock of outstanding borrowings fall. | As a result, by endline we find a 2% reduction in extreme poverty rates among beneficiary households.",
    "study_design": "Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "This paper presents evidence from a large-scale and long-term randomized control trial to evaluate an intervention designed to improve well-being in the first 1000 days of life.",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2015-2019",
    "sample_size": 3600,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": true,
    "qualitative_methods": ["qualitative analysis", "household surveys"],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": "Finally, we conducted our evaluation in close collaboration with a parallel stream of qualitative analysis, based on a subset of our surveyed households.",
    "has_cost_data": true,
    "cost_mentions": "The internal rate of return to the program is over 200% even if net resource impacts die out after five years.",
    "cost_evidence_citation": "Our final set of results assess the cost effectiveness of the intervention. We do so in two steps. First, only accounting for the impact on the endogenous increase in net resources to the household (over and above the value of cash transfers), the internal rate of return to the program is over 200% even if net resource impacts die out after five years."
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "The intervention, known as the Child Development Grant Program (CDGP), is implemented in Northern Nigeria.",
    "country_citation": "The intervention, known as the Child Development Grant Program (CDGP), is implemented in Northern Nigeria.",
    "target_population_citation": "The CDGP is a multifaceted intervention comprising a bundle of: (i) information provided to mothers and fathers on recommended practices related to pregnancy and infant feeding; and (ii) high-valued unconditional cash transfers provided to mothers (beginning during pregnancy)."
  }
}
```
